JOANNA EDGELL

  • Front-End Developer
  • Atlanta, GA

    • Technical Skills & Work Process

    Front-End Development

    I create web applications using HTML, CSS(SCSS), and Javascript and libraries such as jQuery, Handlebars, Underscore.js, jQuery UI and Bourbon Refills. I also have experience working with RESTful APIs, using Backbone.js and some Angular.js

    Responsive Design

    With the rise in use of smartphones and tablets, applications need to be accessible across a number of devices. I have experience with Bourbon Neat, a front-end framework that allows projects to be built on a responsive grid layout.

    Work Process

    I use Balsamiq to create wireframes in order to quickly grasp UI experience and improve the functionality of my projects. When working on group projects, and solo projects, I use Scrum to better organize my time and insure I focus on the most important aspects of a design first.

    Selected Projects

    • Group Project

      This was my first group project. It gave me the opportunity to work with APIs and use Scrum. We primarily used HTML, SASS and jQuery.

      Quick Link

    • Pixel Perfect

      One of my first assignments was to recreate a pixel perfect mock up of a fictional website. I used HTML and CSS.

      Quick Link

    • Safety Net

      This was my final project at the Iron Yard. Safety Net lets parents share their children's medical information privately with other parents. Users can use this information as they plan events to avoid allergens and dietary issues. I primarily used Backbone.js and jQuery, with Parse acting as my backend.

      Quick Link
